chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger <16 Yrs(2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Trenton J Sanders was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Trenton J Sanders was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total fine and costs to be paid during the term of the probationary period.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

Defendant to submit to random testing.

Defendant to participate in parenting counseling and any other counseling as determined by the Probationary Agent.

Defendant is prohibited from entering any establishment which sells alcohol.
Also to attend the Victim Impact Panel

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Consecutive to: Count 2

supervisions.notes: Total fine and costs to be paid during the term of the probationary period of count 1.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Defendant is to submit a DNA sample.

Defendant is to return Sentence Credit worksheet to the court before June 30th, 2017.  Judgment of Conviction will be amended to reflect appropriate credit after submission.

records.addlTxt: jury trial list
06/26/2017 Trial        Exhibit 4 - CD - Stored in CD binder held by exhibit clerk.  Paper exhibits destroyed as of 12/01/2018.

Attorney Jeffrey Sisley appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in person and by Attorney William Mayer.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire as to count 2.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  Court withholds judgment until conclusion of trial.  Counsel addresses Motions in Limine.  Court examines parties as to stipulation.  State as to sequestration of witnesses.
 
09:22 am    Jurors report and given oath; 18 Jurors called to jury box. 
09:26 am    Voir dire by Court.
09:37 am    Voir dire by Attorney Sisley.
09:54 am    Voir dire by Attorney Mayer.
10:05 am    Counsel striking of jury.
10:13 am    12 jurors called to hear case.  All other jurors thanked and returned to Jury room. 
10:16 am    Jury given oath. 
10:17 am    Court preliminary instructions to jury.
10:29 am    Jury excused.
10:30 am    Court/counsel recess. 
10:52 am    Court returns from recess.  Jury recalled to the court room.
10:54 am    Attorney Sisley opening statements.
11:05 am    Attorney Mayer opening statements.
11:10 am    Deputy Ogren sworn and testifies.
12:15 pm    Jurors excused for Noon recess.
01:30 pm    Jury Returns.  State plays video from Deputy squad car.
02:02 pm    Kayla Neuman sworn and testifies.
02:29 pm    State rests subject to rebuttal.
02:29 pm    Jury excused.
02:30 pm    Attorney Mayer moves to dismiss.
02:31 pm    Court in recess.
02:41 pm    Case recalled.  Parties present outside the presence of the Jury.  Counsel advises the court that the defendant does wish to testify, with Counsel's recommendation.  Court conducts colloquy with Defendant as to rights to testify.
02:46 pm    Jury recalled to the court room.
02:47 pm    Trenton Sanders sworn and testifies.
03:17 pm    Defense rests.
03:24 pm    Deputy Ogren testifies, still under oath.
03:30 pm    State rests.
03:33 pm    Jury excused for Jury Instruction conference.
04:28 pm    Jury recalled to the courtroom.  Court delivers Jury Instructions.
04:43 pm    Closing argument by State.
04:56 pm    Closing argument by Defense.
05:06 pm    Rebuttal by the State.
05:08 pm    Court delivers final Jury Instructions.
05:10 pm    Bailiff sworn.
05:13 pm    Jury out for deliberations.
05:14 pm    Court stands in recess.
05:39 pm    Case recalled with all parties present outside the presence of the Jurors.  Court reads question from the Jurors to Counsel.  Parties agree to reply by the Court.  Reply delivered to the Bailiff.
05:45 pm    Court stands in recess.
06:06 pm    Case recalled with all parties present.  Jury recalled into Court with a verdict.
06:08 pm    Jury delivers verdict.  Count 1: Guilty (Yes).  Count 2: Guilty (Yes).  Counsel requests Jury be polled.  Jury polled.  Jury thanked and discharged by the Court.  Note:  Count 3 as indicated in the criminal complaint identified to Jurors as Count 2 for reasons stated on the record.
06:15 pm    State requests verdict.  Court grants judgment on the verdict.  Counsel requests later date for sentencing.  Court to proceed to sentencing.
06:16 pm    Court in recess to allow counsel to confer with Defendant.
06:28 pm    Case recalled with all parties present.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Counsel makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.  Judge orders previously forfeited bonds reinstated to cover fine and costs incurred.
Proposed Verdict Not Guilty Count 3
Proposed Verdict Guilty Count 3
Proposed Verdict Not Guilty Count 2
Proposed Verdict Guilty Count 2
Proposed Verdict Not Guilty Count 1
Proposed Verdict Guilty Count 1
